column4: ok. i installed the drive now in a p3 733mhz with 512mb ram. there it boots but not on my p1 200mhz 64mb ram. how could that be?
umm thats way too low of a spec..you need more memory 192 meg as min
it dont matter, to load ubuntu thats the min
unless you have a cdrom that has the bare minimum ubuntu..
oh no. how odd. are there ubuntu kernels i can get through apt which have lower ram usage?
im not familiar with all the different versions, but for such a low spec system, try DSL linux instead
you need to start reading the readme files to learn the min requirements for these
why does ubuntu kernels require so much ram? after all, it's just a linux kernel
i cant answer that ..im not the packager for ubuntu :)
i gave you an alternative...DSL linux
fork out the big mullah..aka greenbux then you will get great support ..hehehe
